alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Jasper; Jefferson; Orange (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 24 at 3:19PM CST until January 24 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Jefferson County in southeastern Texas... Southern Hardin County in southeastern Texas... Western Orange County in southeastern Texas... South central Jasper County in southeastern Texas... * Until 400 PM CST. * At 318 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Daisetta to 6 miles southeast of Devers to 9 miles north of Bolivar Peninsula, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Beaumont, Port Arthur, Nederland, Groves, Port Neches, Lumberton, Vidor, Bridge City, Silsbee, Sour Lake, Nome, Hamshire, Evadale, Central Gardens, Bevil Oaks, China, Rose City, Pine Forest, Lakeview and Weiss Bluff. This includes Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 869 and 832. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southeastern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southeastern Texas.
